review_title: Great as all over face powder!
review_content:
I was super sad when I found out that Sugarbomb was no longer being carried with Sephora. I got GoldRush to use as an all-over-face powder. I absolutely LOVE the smell and soft dewy glow it gives me. I can't believe so many people say they don't like the smell. I'm obsessed with it and I even open up the box and just take a deep whiff. I do wish the gold was mixed in throughout the whole product. And I wish it was offered with as much product volume as the Sugarbomb had (12g!!) This only has 5g!! and seems kind of like a rip off for being the same price.

review_content: At first i hate this product, like it don't even showed up on my face, but i still give it a chance, cus i love all benefit blusher! I try to put this blush with shimmer bronzer (i use the too faced sweet tea one), and a little bit of ofra highlight. And it's turned out amazinggg! I got the most amazing gloww, gold kind of gloww. user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Olive', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
I love Benefit’s line of box o’ powders! I have to admit, this isn’t the one I use the most, but I still think it has some good things going for it. First, it’s true that the gold fleck spray on the top of the powder goes away with a few swipes of a brush upon first use, and to me that is a good thing! What you are then left with is a super subtle peach toned blush with some super subtle gold highlight. I have light olive skin, and this took quite a few swipes to build up a noticeable color to my cheeks. I think this would appeal to gals who are super fair skinned and prefer a more natural makeup look. I have a hard time seeing this work well for deeper skin tones and most women of color...this seems tailor made for seriously white girls! I find myself using this most often as an overall setting powder if I want to do a more dewy finish. Would recommend to any light skinned ladies seeking a subtle highlighter than can be built up as a blusher.

review_title: This is a fair girl's product. Not inclusive!
review_content:
A very light but glowy peach blush. Even with heavy build up, the color is faint. I'm fair neutral and this barely shows up on me and sheer and works better as a blush topper or highlighter imo. It's not terrible product but it's not for everyone either.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Skin Type Normal']
review_content:
If you are looking for an in depth review on this product head over to my YouTube channel at Michelle's Everyday Glamour to have all your questions answered! In a nutshell, this blush is everything I was hoping it would be. My expectations for Benefit are always high, I'm always hoping their new release will at least match the last one....and it did. I was every bit as pleased with the tone and finish of this blush. It's so natural and buildable, that perfect shade to give you a healthy 'glow'. A couple of things to note: It definitely has a perfume-y scent, so if you are sensitive to that, beware! I also don't know that it is truly 'universally flattering'. I always say this is a high claim because it's truly difficult to produce something that will truly fit all skin tones. I am a light medium with neutral undertones and it is lovely on me. I think it would look good on medium skin tones, but I don't know that it would really show up on my lovelies with deeper skin tones....something to be aware of also. All in all, very happy I purchased this blush and will be putting it to very good use!
…read more

review_title: Beautiful blush, once you get past the tacky gold
review_content: The color of this is beautiful, a very pigmented warm pink. Blends easily and looks great on. The problem is the chunky gold glitter overlay. Why benefit?
